intro: Bulbostylis longiradiata, commonly known as the long-rayed bulbostylis, is a species of grass belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Bulbostylis longiradiata typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils.
